channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report X-2024010388
item.description:
Report X-2024010388

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-02
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS RETREIVED BY A DESIGNATED RESPONDER FROM DOOR 250. BOX SAT IN DMP AWAITING DAMAGE INSPECTION AND TO DETERMINE HOW TO PROCEED WITH DAMAGE OR DISPOSAL OF CONTENTS. DESIGNATED RESPONDER TOOK THE PACKAGE FOR INITAL DAMAGE INSPECTION AND FOUND LIMITED QUANTITY MARKING ON INTERIOR BOXES (REWRAP; NO LEAK) BUT THERE WERE NO MARKINGS OF ANY KIND ON THE EXTERIOR PACKAGE. SUPERVISOR WAS CALLED FOR UNDECLAIRED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL.

item.title: Report X-2024010432
item.description:

  • Description: A PACKAGE WAS BEING AUDITED AND IT WAS DISCOVERED TO BE LEAKING. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER DISPOSED OF THE LEAKING PRODUCT AND RETURNED THE OTHER CONTAINER IN A SALVAGE DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2024010174
item.description:
Report X-2024010174

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-13
  • City: OLATHE
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded off truck and in transit to Van lines when manager contact QA in regards to leaking packing. DescribePack: Clip on paint can failed causing content to leak DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Package was contained in a lined red Hazmat tote and taking to the QA area for pressings,

item.title: Report E-2024010310
item.description:
Report E-2024010310

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-19T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-19
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2 quarts of Sikadur®-35 Hi-Mod LV Part A (UN3082 9, III) were released from one 2-gallon metal pail due to improper loading by XKC. The release impacted the concrete near the OS&D dock. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. (1)10 gallon DM containing one 2-gallon metal pail of Sikadur®-35 Hi-Mod LV Part A and oil dri was created as waste and left for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010182
item.description:
Report X-2024010182

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-15
  • City: COLBY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found during unload on trailer. 1 box with 2 containers of disinfectant leaking from nozzle. Package was not loaded on floor. PH notified manager who confirmed no additional contamination and removed package from work area. DescribePack: Leaking nozzle on 2 containers. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed contents and packaging inside of hazmat tote, cleared area of contamination to resume work.
